name: Boskerris Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything written in previous reviews is correct. The rooms, the lounge, dining room, everywhere was beautiful. What I wanted to comment on was the food. I had not realised they did dinner until we got there. What a treat. The first night we had sea bass. We had eated sea bass the day before at Rick Stein's Seafood restaurant in Padstow. This was every bit as good! So good, we had dinner there the second night too. Again excellent food, very hot (so unusual these days!) and superb quality. You must also have the cream tea! The scones are so light and fluffy they won't spoil your dinner. But the most outstanding aspect of this hotel is the staff. They really are a credit to themselves and the hotel. Nothing is too much trouble. You want extra biscotti with your coffee - no problem. We were so spoilt! They were all genuinely friendly, interested in us and making sure we had a great time in Cornwall. I do have one regret - I wish we had booked for longer. Not a mistake I'll be making next year! Thank you everyone.
reviews.title: They had me at 'hello'

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: stayed for 4 nights late june ,staff always helpful and friendly,hotel very bright and fresh ,room spotless ,view over carbis bay amazing ,room 3 spacious with luxury bathroom ,highly recommended ,in my opinion probably nicest hotel in cornwall .
reviews.title: cornwall visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a long weekend at Boskerris last year. We had a wonderful time. Our room was lovely, overlooking the bay. The breakfast was delicious (particularly the homemade muesli!) We had a lovely walk along the coastal path from Carbis Bay to St Ives. Boskerris is a great location in Cornwall. We had a great weekend. The staff were very friendly. We had a lovely evening having a few drinks in the bar before going for dinner in St Ives. I would highly recommend staying here.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay at Boskerris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was a beautiful experience from arrival all through till departure. The first thing to mention is the knowledgeable and courteous staff. The scenery was lovely, although my visit my nearly ruined by the rain I had a fantastic time.
reviews.title: Beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The kitchen serves the best meals I have ever had in any hotel and can compete with most acclaimed restaurants. The dinning room overlooks the sea which is magnificent.
reviews.title: We would like to have stayed longer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed back in September last year for 5 nights (only just got round to reviewing!) We were thoroughly impressed with everything about this hotel and actually went there based on it being the top hotel in St Ives on trip advisor!
reviews.title: Fabulous place to stay in Carbis Bay,St Ives Highly recommend!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautifully furnished throughout, fabulous breakfast choices, wonderful decking area, close to Train to go to St Ives which means ideal as can leave car there. Staff wonderful nothing too much trouble. We were expecting it to be good but it exceeded our expectations - would highly recommend it as a lovely relaxing luxury place to stay.
reviews.title: Lovely place
Wonderful Inn
reviews.text: We only had a back room as at the top of our price range but worth every penny!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only wish the weather had been better as it was rainy and windy!!!
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a delightful hotel. Beautifully decorated and spotlessly clean. Amazing views from the very smart bar and deck overlooking the bay. The staff couldn't be more helpful and welcoming. Breakfast was excellent, all freshly prepared and locally sourced.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: Just spent 3 nights at this hotel. Haven't reached home yet (just left this morning), but felt compelled to write a review of our stay here. This place is a must stay if visiting St Ives. The place itself is beautifully decorated, in a fab location, with great views of the coast, food that rivals any top restaurant I've eaten in in London...the staff/owners are superbly hospitable...out first time in Cornwall and we will certainly be returning...would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a first class experience!
reviews.title: Can't wait to return!

reviews.text: Superb hotel- small, but very professional at the same time. Beautifully decorated and co-ordinated throughout with in relaxing- "beach" themes. You will feel "at-home" from the start. Spotlessly clean and very good attention to detail, made our short stay very enjoyable. We particularly appreciated the extra information on St Ives, that the owners have gone have taken the trouble to provide. Cant wait to go back- especially the very close-sandy beach and numerous art galleries in St Ives1
reviews.title: May bank holiday break

reviews.text: We stayed here with our two teenage children in a family room which had a king bed in the main room and bunks in a small adjoining room. The service from the staff here was amazing. Everything was clearly explained, suggestions were made for outings and nothing was too much trouble. We stayed in one evening as our son was unwell and ate at the restaurant on-site. Both the food and service were fabulous and the kitchen prepared separate food for our son that wasn't on the menu that we could take back to him in our room. Breakfast was the best of anywhere we'd stayed during our 5 week trip and the staff were particularly pleased that they had vegemite for us.
reviews.title: Exceptional customer service
Beautiful Boskerris in St. Ives
reviews.text: We both walked and caught the train into St Ives and enjoyed both. Our daughter hired a wetsuit and board from St Ives surf school and had fun surfing while we enjoyed the coffee and cakes at the Porthmeor Cafe! The highlight of our trip here was the Minack Theatre. If you can get there, go. It is spectacular.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Can't speak highly enough about how well looked after we were during our stay here.
reviews.title: Stunning hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Two wonderful nights at this amazing small hotel, but with such attention to detail from the whole team. Felt so much at home, our room (15) and all public spaces so fresh and comfortable. Will definitely be back. We were seeking a weekend of total R&R and we really got it.
reviews.title: Such a brilliant experience....
Another wonderful stay
reviews.text: This was our second visit to the outstanding Boskerris.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent two nights to celebrate our wedding anniversary, and were given room 4 which was stunning. The incredibly comfortable bed is positioned so that you have amazing views of Carbis Bay Godrevy and St Ives from both it and the bathroom !
reviews.title: most pleasurable experience

reviews.text: This hotel is luxurious in every way, and decorated in natural tones with very tasteful furnishings in all areas.
reviews.title: Everything we were hoping, and more . . .

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The warm welcome and unintrusive attention that guests receive from Marianne and all her staff is wonderful.
reviews.title: Simply Wonderful Break

description: The Boskerris is a contemporary, boutique hotel with a relaxed Mediterranean style. The hotel has fifteen elegant and stylish bedrooms, most with outstanding panoramic ocean views.The hotel is nestled in the Cornish coastline, on the edge of St Ives. Discreetly set in one and a half acres in a unique position, with the decked terrace being the perfect vantage point to admire the views across St Ives Bay from Godrevy Lighthouse to St Ives harbour.
